constructors.doc: Creates a toplevel container widget that is used to retrieve snapshots of widgets without showing them on the screen.
constructors.name: new

doc:
GtkOffscreenWindow is strictly intended to be used for obtaining snapshots of widgets that are not part of a normal widget hierarchy. Since is a toplevel widget you cannot obtain snapshots of a full window with it since you cannot pack a toplevel widget in another toplevel.

The idea is to take a widget and manually set the state of it, add it to a GtkOffscreenWindow and then retrieve the snapshot as a #cairo_surface_t or GdkPixbuf.Pixbuf.

GtkOffscreenWindow derives from only as an implementation detail. Applications should not use any API specific to to operate on this object. It should be treated as a that has no parent widget.

When contained offscreen widgets are redrawn, GtkOffscreenWindow will emit a signal.

methods.doc: Retrieves a snapshot of the contained widget in the form of a GdkPixbuf.Pixbuf. This is a new pixbuf with a reference count of 1, and the application should unreference it once it is no longer needed.
methods.name: get_pixbuf

methods.doc: Retrieves a snapshot of the contained widget in the form of a #cairo_surface_t. If you need to keep this around over window resizes then you should add a reference to it.
methods.name: get_surface

name: OffscreenWindow
